trans-unit.source: Camera which specifies the view and projection transforms as <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Matrix3D"></xref> objects
This camera enables applications to calculate their own view and projection matrices.
This allows applications to define cameras not directly supported by the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.ProjectionCamera> subclasses.
Using a MatrixCamera is the only way an application can know what the View/Projection matrices are.
A MatrixCamera can be animated using the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Camera.Transform%2A> property.
Creates a new instance of <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.MatrixCamera"></xref>.
Creates a new <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.MatrixCamera"></xref> from view and projection matrices.
Specifies the camera's view matrix.
Specifies the camera's projection matrix.
Creates a modifiable clone of this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.MatrixCamera"></xref>, making deep copies of this object's values.
When copying dependency properties, this method copies resource references and data bindings (but they might no longer resolve) but not animations or their current values.
This method is used to produce modifiable copies of frozen <xref:System.Windows.Freezable> objects (or any <xref:System.Windows.Freezable> object).
For convenience, this method shadows the inherited version with a strongly typed implementation.
For more information, see <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.Clone%2A?displayProperty=fullName>.
A modifiable clone of the current object.

The cloned object's <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen*> property will be <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref> even if the source's <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen*> property was <xref uid="langword_csharp_true." name="true." href=""></xref>
Creates a modifiable clone of this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.MatrixCamera"></xref> object, making deep copies of this object's current values.
Resource references, data bindings, and animations are not copied, but their current values are.
This method is used to produce modifiable copies of frozen <xref:System.Windows.Freezable> objects (or any <xref:System.Windows.Freezable> object).
For convenience, this method shadows the inherited version with a strongly typed implementation.
A modifiable clone of the current object.

The cloned object's <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen*> property will be <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref> even if the source's <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen*> property was <xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref>.
To be added.
Gets or sets a <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Matrix3D"></xref> as the projection transformation matrix.
This property is useful for applications that implement their own projection matrix calculation.
This property transforms the coordinate system from camera space to a normalized cube where the X and Y coordinates range from -1 to 1 and the Z coordinate ranges from zero to 1.
The minimum and maximum Z coordinates in camera space are defined by how the projection matrix transforms the Z coordinate.
## Dependency Property Information ||| |-|-| |Identifier field|| |Metadata properties set to `true`|None|
<xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Matrix3D"></xref> that specifies the projection transformation.
Identifies the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.MatrixCamera.ProjectionMatrix*> dependency property.
To be added.
Gets or sets a <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Matrix3D"></xref> as the view transformation matrix.
This property is useful for applications that implement their own projection matrix calculation.
The camera properties specified by this matrix might differ from the top-level transform of the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Model3D> hierarchy.
## Dependency Property Information ||| |-|-| |Identifier field|| |Metadata properties set to `true`|None|
A <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Matrix3D"></xref>that represents the position, look direction and up vector for the camera.
Gets the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.MatrixCamera.ViewMatrix*> dependency property.
To be added.
